title: How to Start a New Settlement in Fallout 4

steps.headline: Travel to a location on your map that includes a workstation.
Gain access to the workstation.
steps.description: If the area is occupied by hostiles, clear them out. If it is occupied by non-hostiles, you will need to perform some task to help them first.

steps.headline: Begin building.
steps.description: Clean out the area for materials to use for scrap.

steps.headline: Build some beds.
steps.description: Place them inside of a structure.

steps.headline: Build some defenses.
steps.description: Place guard posts, set traps, and build turrets.

steps.headline: Build a radio transmitter.
steps.description: This will attract settlers to your new settlement.

steps.headline: Trade with and assign positions to settlers.
steps.description: You can give them specific jobs and give them better armor/weaponry.

steps.headline: Wait until you have a fairly large settlement.
steps.description: Once you have 10 or more settlers, build trading stations and shops.

text: Travel to a location on your map that includes a workstation.  Gain access to the workstation. If the area is occupied by hostiles, clear them out. If it is occupied by non-hostiles, you will need to perform some task to help them first. Begin building. Clean out the area for materials to use for scrap. Build some beds. Place them inside of a structure. Build a water pump.  Grow some crops. Grow various kinds of vegetables. Build some defenses. Place guard posts, set traps, and build turrets. Build a radio transmitter. This will attract settlers to your new settlement. Trade with and assign positions to settlers. You can give them specific jobs and give them better armor/weaponry. Wait until you have a fairly large settlement. Once you have 10 or more settlers, build trading stations and shops.
